f5c95cc981bd.name: Startup Grind
f5c95cc981bd.shortDescription: The life, work, and tactics of entrepreneurs around the…

paragraphs.text: Self-Editing for Fiction Writers by Renni Browne and Dave King
paragraphs.name: e0a3

paragraphs.text: Of all of the books on this list, The Writer’s Journey might be my favorite. It’s taught me more about story structure than any other resource, including my undergraduate and graduate work in creative writing. It’s a step-by-step guide through the classic hero’s journey with examples and exercises that will improve your writing if you pay attention. My free course The Plotting Workshop is based on The Writer’s Journey.
paragraphs.name: 9c2c
a6cc
paragraphs.text: You’d have to look hard to find a list of books for writers that doesn’t include this one. That’s not because the people who make the lists are lazy or unimaginative. It’s because it’s that good. If you only buy one, buy this one.

paragraphs.name: ca6d
paragraphs.text: Actually, what I need is help getting my stuff published once it’s written.

“Writing isn’t about making money, getting famous, getting dates, getting laid, or making friends. In the end, it’s about enriching the lives of those who will read your work, and enriching your own life, as well. It’s about getting up, getting well, and getting over. Getting happy, okay? Getting happy.”
paragraphs.name: 037c

d5f86b2fbcde.title: If you don’t have time for a book, Ann Patchett’s essay, “The Getaway Car: A Practical Memoir About…

paragraphs.text: If you don’t have time for a book, Ann Patchett’s essay, “The Getaway Car: A Practical Memoir About Writing and Life” does it for me every single time.
paragraphs.name: 2bf6

94e6f638dcf5.title: Another book about writing I never tire of recommending is Telling Lies for Fun & Profit by…

paragraphs.text: Another book about writing I never tire of recommending is Telling Lies for Fun & Profit by Lawrence Block. The advice on publishing is a bit outdated, but the writing advice is great. Block is one of those guys who can churn out multiple good mystery novels in a year, and his bag of tricks is large and varied.

8b96e2d302b6.title: I read Steal Like An Artist with my youngest — it’s a book that applies no matter how old you are!

paragraphs.text: I read Steal Like An Artist with my youngest — it’s a book that applies no matter how old you are! And is great for those who struggle with creativity.

ccd716f42fa7.title: Looks like a very useful list, thanks.

paragraphs.text: Looks like a very useful list, thanks. I’ve already read On Writing by Stephen King, which is outstanding. Write. Publish. Repeat is very helpful as well.

faa2c40b6b6.title: I’m so glad you joined Medium!

paragraphs.text: I’m so glad you joined Medium! I find your practical advice helpful and inspiring. Thanks for this list. I can’t wait to read your next post!

paragraphs.text: Well said
paragraphs.name: 6a5f

paragraphs.text: Shaunta, a great list. Of them, the one I recommend most is The Writer’s Journey, especially since most of my clients are mystery or SF/F writers and that book nails it for them. One you missed is the 1934 classic Becoming a Writer by Dorthea Brande. It is about the mindset of writers — something that is a timeless subject (and issue!). Sometimes a…
paragraphs.name: 5aa5

paragraphs.text: Many terrific choices here, Shaunta. On Writing is essential, in my opinion. Gone cover to cover with that one at least 3 times and utilized it for points of reference dozens more.

paragraphs.text: The language used in the Table of Contents sounds close to (or like a modern version of) Joseph Campbell’s The Hero With a Thousand Faces. How heavily does Christopher Vogler draw on Campbell, and how much new material does he contribute?

We have several good ones in the area in the PNW: Village Bookstore in Bellingham, Barnes and Noble — several Seattle area locations, Twice Used Books in Seattle, Elliott Bay Bookstore in Seattle, Third Place Books (new and used…

ef90f066edd5.title: To this excellent list of writers on writing I will add:

paragraphs.text: To this excellent list of writers on writing I will add:

Donald Hall — Life Work is an excellent meditation on how to live well through work, poetic in its spare simplicity. The fact that he gets news of his imminent mortality halfway through the writing of the book, and then just proceeds to incorporate the new reality into…

a9691d834540.title: I would add “Ernest Hemingway on Writing” — if you think writing is difficult for you, wait until…

paragraphs.text: I would add “Ernest Hemingway on Writing” — if you think writing is difficult for you, wait until you learn how difficult it was for him, then feel better.
